description: Celebration of the start of the new calendar year, marked with fireworks, parties, and various cultural traditions worldwide.
A North American tradition where a groundhog predicts the weather for the coming weeks. Celebrated with festivities and media coverage.
A Japanese festival marking the beginning of spring, where people throw beans to drive away evil spirits.
A global event to raise awareness about cancer, promote prevention, and encourage research and treatment efforts.
A Mexican national holiday that commemorates the enactment of the country's constitution in 1917.
A Christian holiday celebrating the visit of the three wise men to the baby Jesus. It's celebrated in many countries, especially in Spain and Latin America.
Celebrated by Orthodox Christians, it marks the birth of Jesus Christ, following the Julian calendar.
A global celebration of the achievements and contributions of women, advocating for gender equality.
A fun day to celebrate and enjoy the beloved dish of pizza, with special deals and promotions in many restaurants.
A day to promote the nutritional benefits of pulses (legumes), highlighting their role in sustainable food systems.
A day dedicated to promoting gender equality in science and encouraging the participation of women and girls in scientific fields.
A holiday in the Americas recognizing Christopher Columbus' arrival and the heritage of indigenous peoples.
A day to celebrate the role of radio in promoting freedom of expression, diversity, and access to information.
A celebration of love and affection between partners, family, and friends, often with gifts, cards, and romantic gestures.
A day to raise awareness and promote advocacy for children with cancer, highlighting the need for research and support.
Commemorates Lithuania's declaration of independence from the Russian Empire in 1918.
An Irish celebration of Saint Patrick, featuring parades, wearing green, and cultural festivities to honor Irelandâ€™s patron saint.
A celebration of the contributions of women in the arts, highlighting female artists and their impact on culture.
A day to celebrate fathers and father figures, often with gifts, meals, and family gatherings.
A day to focus on promoting happiness and well-being for all people around the world.
A day dedicated to promoting peace, ceasefire, and the recognition of peacebuilding efforts worldwide.
A day for families to gather, give thanks, and enjoy a meal, especially celebrated in the United States and Canada.
A celebration of books and reading, with events and special promotions to encourage literacy and education.
Commemorates Venezuela's declaration of independence from Spain in 1811.
A Christian holiday celebrating the birth of Jesus Christ, marked by family gatherings, gift-giving, and festive meals.
A day after Christmas celebrated in the UK, Canada, and Australia with sales, sports, and charitable giving.
A day to celebrate global tourism and its importance to economic growth and cultural exchange.
Similar to April Fools' Day, this day is marked by pranks and jokes in Spain and Latin America.
A Jewish holiday commemorating the rededication of the Second Temple in Jerusalem, marked by lighting candles and family celebrations.
A day to recognize the importance of friendships and encourage people to strengthen their social bonds.
A celebration of spooky fun with costumes, trick-or-treating, and parties, followed by the Christian observance of All Saints' Day.
